metadata.name: Intro
metadata.value:
We are OMP, a game changer that optimizes supply chains of the world’s leading companies with our very own smart software and services.  

Do you like deep diving into one of our core products? Do you enjoy empowering others by sharing expertise? And does it thrill you to contribute to the future of our solution?

If that sounds good, a career as Product Consultant might be right up your alley.

metadata.name: Profile
metadata.value:
A Master’s or PhD degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Applied Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or similar. 
Great analytical skills and problem-solving abilities.
A desire to take ownership of your projects.
Strong affinity with IT systems.
Basic programming skills. 
The flexibility to travel.
Comfortable under deadlines and pressure.

metadata.name: Bonus Points (Profile)
metadata.value:
1 to 3 years of relevant working experience in supply chain planning or business software implementation. 
Affinity with mathematical modeling and/or machine learning techniques. 
Prior experience in one of our core industries.
But most of all, you are fun to work with and a great team player!

metadata.name: Your Future
metadata.value:
At OMP, we’re eager to find your best career fit. Our talent management program supports your personal development and empowers you to build a career in line with your ambitions. 

Many of our team members who start as a product consultant grow into the role of solution architect, product expert, product architect, product manager, or project manager.

metadata.name: Your Team
metadata.value: As a Product Consultant, you’ll join the Product Development organization. Product Development consists of specialized teams that focus on a specific domain such as demand and supply planning, user experience, data science, integration, solvers, and more. These teams drive our product road map, share OMP’s vision and expertise and create smart, robust, and scalable software solutions that solve our customers’ complex supply chain planning challenges.

metadata.name: SEO description
metadata.value: Do you like deep diving into one of our core products? Do you enjoy empowering others by sharing expertise? Join OMP!

title: Product Consultant Operations Research
content:
As a product consultant, you use your expertise in one of our supply chain planning domains to support our customer project teams. In cooperation with our product experts, you implement project-specific solutions and best practices within your domain of expertise, with a focus on bringing new global, cross-industry product developments to the market.
You’re responsible for:
Growing expertise in one of our core product functions: network design, demand management, S&OP, operational planning, scheduling, cloud, data management & integration, or value enhancers.Providing our solution architects with direct support within your specific product domain of expertise.Providing implementation consultants with specialist product support in the field of project delivery, documentation, and training across all OMP’s core industries.Solving customer-specific challenges related to your product domain, guided by our product experts.Briefing product managers on potential product differentiators and gaps in our product offering based on interactions with customers, implementation consultants and solution architects.Designing and building prototypes for specific customer problems on an occasional basis.
Your team:
As a member of the Solver team within Product Development, you will have the opportunity to contribute to a wide range of functionalities used for automatically creating a supply plan that meets the given demand, constrained by the available production capabilities. With our different team members, we are involved end-to-end in delivering a supply planning solution towards our customers, i.e. from taking up a Product Expert role in complex customer projects as well as rolling out brand new and more innovative functionalities within pilot customer projects all the way towards the design and implementation of those functionalities in our C++ and PAK layers. Additionally, we are actively involved in the design and maintenance of trainings linked to our areas of expertise.
 
You will be working on developing and/or configuring our broad proprietary solver offering, related to various fields and technologies like Inventory optimization, S&OP, Distribution planning, Production planning, Sequencing based on Mathematical programming, Constructive and improvement heuristics, Meta-heuristics, Machine learning and XAIs
All in the context of providing to our customers the best-fit automated solution for their planning process, leveraging a hybrid mix of algorithms.
 
Your profile:
Preferably experience with implementing/analyzing topics in projects within the domain of implementing solvers

questions.label: How many years of experience do you have?
